original: Lindquist, Johan (John) Sixtus, läroverksadjunkt, Falköping, f. 6/8/82 i Stora Meliiby, Älvsb. ■!., av Alexander L. o. Matilda Andersson. G. 18 m. Signe Jägerhokn. Barn: Ingegerd f. 19, Per-Ingemar 20, Gunvor 28. — Mogrex. v. Fjelktedtska sk. i Upps. 07, stud. v. Gbgs högsk. 07, teol. fil. ex. i Lund 08, teoJ. kand. 10, fil. kand. 12, pro vår v. Gbgs h. real 16. Vik. adj. v. Falu folksk:sem. 10, Halmstads h. a. 1. 12-13, Vänersb. 14-15, Gbgs h. real 15 o. 16-17, adj. i kristend :kunsk. o. modersm. v. Falköp. samrealsk. sed. 17. Medi. av Götiska förb. o. Sällsk. NN. RVO.
translated: Lindquist, Johan (John) Sixtus, school teacher, Falköping, b. 6/8/82 in Stora Meliiby, Älvsb. county, son of Alexander L. and Matilda Andersson. Married in 1918 to Signe Jägerhokn. Children: Ingegerd b. 1919, Per-Ingemar b. 1920, Gunvor b. 1928. Graduated from Fjelktedtska school in Uppsala in 1907, studied at Gothenburg University in 1907, obtained a Bachelor's degree in theology from Lund in 1908, completed his theology candidate degree in 1910, obtained a Bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1912, and became a teacher at Gothenburg High School in 1916. Temporary teacher at Falu folk high school in 1910, Halmstad high school from 1912-1913, Vänersborg from 1914-1915, Gothenburg High School in 1915 and 1916-1917, and teacher of religious studies and mother tongue at Falköping secondary school since 1917. Member of Götiska förbundet and Sällskapet NN. Recipient of the Order of the Polar Star (RVO).
